title: Executive Assistant / Business Manager (Airbnb Operations) Job at Raphael Group
content:
Raphael Group is professional Virtual Assistant service that connects employers with skilled remote assistants. We offer a wide range of services to support individuals and businesses, including scheduling, email management, research, and more. We take the hassle out of finding and hiring qualified virtual assistants, allowing you to focus on growing your business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant / Business Manager (Airbnb Operations)

Job Location: Remote
Employment Type: Full-time
Working Hours:Full-time: (Wednesday - Sunday, 10 am - 4 pm)

About the Role
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We’re seeking a highly organized, proactive, and experienced Executive Assistant / Business Manager to oversee daily operations and manage a remote team of Virtual Assistants (VAs), cleaners, and service providers for an established Airbnb property management business.
	This role is ideal for someone with a solid background in Airbnb hosting or short-term rental property management, combined with exceptional people management and leadership skills.
	You will serve as the right hand to the business owner - ensuring seamless day-to-day operations, managing teams, and maintaining high standards across all properties.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee and coordinate a team of Virtual Assistants (VAs) responsible for guest communications, calendar management, and operational tasks.
	Manage schedules, assign tasks, and monitor performance of VAs, cleaning staff, maintenance personnel, and other service providers (e.g., electricians, plumbers, handymen).
	Ensure all Airbnb properties are guest-ready, well-maintained, and compliant with hosting standards at all times.
	Handle escalated issues from team members or on-the-ground staff quickly and professionally.
	Coordinate regular property inspections, deep cleaning schedules, and urgent repair needs.
	Assist with onboarding, training, and performance evaluations of new team members.
	Create and maintain systems and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) that promote efficiency, accountability, and outstanding guest experiences.
	Provide executive-level support to the business owner - including project tracking, operational reporting, and highlevel administrative support.


Requirements


	3+ years of experience in Airbnb or vacation rental management, property coordination, or short-term rental operations.
	Proven experience in managing remote teams.
	Strong interpersonal, organizational, and leadership skills; capable of guiding teams with clarity, empathy, and decisiveness.
	Proficiency in using tools such as the Airbnb platform, Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Calendar), Slack, Trello or Asana (project management tools), and other property management software.
	Self-motivated, detail-oriented, and able to resolve problems efficiently under pressure.
	Willingness to be on-call and responsive to urgent matters that may arise on weekends.


What We Offer


	Salary:N175,000 / Monthly.
	A key leadership role within a growing and professional Airbnb management company
	Remote working environment with flexibility and autonomy
	Opportunities to lead and scale a remote operations team
	Competitive pay with performance-based growth potential.

title: Study Abroad Consultant Job at HRLeverage Africa
content:
HRLeverage Africa - Our client, a leading international education firm, is recruiting suitable candidates to join their team in the capacity below:

Job Position: Study Abroad Consultant

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Position Overview
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The ideal candidate will provide expert guidance to students seeking higher education opportunities abroad, particularly in countries like the USA, UK, Canada, and Australia.
	The role involves end-to-end student counselling, application support, visa guidance, and conducting seminars and information sessions.
	Strong communication skills and prior experience in the study abroad or education consultancy domain are preferred.


Key Responsibilities


	Guide students on study abroad destinations, programs, and career pathways
	Manage the complete application process, including SOPs, LORs, documentation, and visa formalities
	Conduct webinars, seminars, and sessions to educate prospective students and parents
	Respond to walk-in inquiries and follow up with leads through calls, emails, and online platforms
	Stay up to date on university admission cycles, requirements, and international visa policies
	Build and maintain strong relationships with global academic institutions
	Utilize CRM tools to track student applications and manage records
	Support students with pre-departure briefings and travel arrangements


Key Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree or higher in Education, Counselling, or a related field
	Experience in study abroad counselling or education consultancy is an advantage
	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills
	Familiarity with international education systems and visa protocols
	Ability to thrive in a goal-driven, student-focused environment.


Salary


	N200,000 - N300,000 per month (Negotiable based on experience and qualifications).


Benefits:


	Career growth and development opportunities
	Supportive and collaborative work environment
	Exposure to global institutions and processes.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a cover letter to: hr.hrleverageafrica@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: HSE Officer Job at HRLeverage
content:
HRLeverage delivers excellent spectrum of HR Business Solutions and strategic management support services through a customs built approach for organisations.As a premium professional HR Boutique firm domicile in Africa, with our global partners, we leverage on technology in providing a one-stop human resources services to various industries in terms of Staffing, Outsourcing, Executive search and recruitment, HR advisory, HR4SMEs, Expatriate management.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HSE Officer

Job Location: Mokwa, Niger

Responsibilities
HSE Compliance & Monitoring:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Ensure that all activities comply with applicable HSE regulations and company policies.
	Conduct regular inspections and audits to identify hazards and ensure corrective actions are implemented.


Risk Assessment & Control:


	Carry out risk assessments and enforce preventive measures.
	Develop, implement, and monitor safe work procedures and practices.


Training & Awareness:


	Conduct HSE inductions and regular safety training for employees and contractors.
	Promote safety awareness and culture through campaigns, toolbox talks, and meetings.


Incident Investigation & Reporting:


	Investigate incidents, accidents, near misses, and unsafe conditions; prepare reports and recommend corrective actions.
	Maintain incident records and follow up on the implementation of improvements.


Documentation & Reporting:


	Prepare and maintain accurate HSE documentation and reports, including safety statistics and compliance logs.
	Support in preparing reports for regulatory authorities as required.


Emergency Preparedness:


	Ensure emergency response plans are developed, tested, and updated.
	Conduct drills and training on emergency procedures.


Environmental Management:


	Monitor and report environmental impacts, including waste, emissions, and spills.
	Promote environmentally sustainable practices and compliance with environmental regulations.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an HND / Bachelor's Degree with 2-4 years of work experience.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: ogohjohn92@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Client Service / Account Management Officer
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for a Client Service / Account Management Officer to manage end-to-end client interactions, ensure accurate costing and budgeting, and support seamless execution of brand activation and experiential marketing campaigns.


Key Responsibilities


	Serve as the primary liaison between clients, vendors, and internal teams.
	Lead project cost estimation, budgeting, and financial tracking using QS expertise.
	Prepare BOQs, job measurements, and ensure accurate documentation.
	Monitor project timelines, ensuring timely delivery and quality control.
	Coordinate with vendors and production teams to deliver on client expectations.


Requirements


	BSc/HND in Quantity Surveying or related field.
	Minimum of 2–3 years of experience in client servicing or account/project management.
	Strong analytical, budgeting, and vendor negotiation skills.
	Excellent communication and organizational skills.
	Familiarity with branding, activation, or marketing projects is an advantage.


Salary
N150,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs and cover letter (to be sent as body of the mail, not attachment) : recruitingtalents24@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
